category: back injury, head or face injury
text: saw kicked back and struck employee while cutting pipe.  a team member was attempting to cut a previously installed 8” ductile iron pipe with a husqvarna k760 quick cut saw. as the employee was completing the cut the saw blade became bound and the saw kicked back striking the employee in the center facial area.  the employee received 12 stitches and was released back to workthe employee was wearing a face shield and safety glasses.  administered pressure to the wound with first aid kit and took employee directly to the hospital right across the street from the job-site. treated and released with return to work with fracture to nose and 12 stitches. client and management notifications were completed.incident investigation team was assignedhsse safety alert generated

pain in stomach post lifting a water pump the previous day. a trades assistant reported on the 14/10 at 11:30am that he was experiencing pain in his stomach. he noted he lifted a water pump onto the back of the work utility the previous day at approximately 2:00pm. employee was taken to local medical provider for precautionary review after the incident was reported to his supervisor.

employee was lifting an oxygen cylinder into the bed of their truck.  as the employee was lifting the bottle into the bed of their truck, they felt discomfort in their back.  work was stopped and the employee contacted the safety department. migrated from legacy cairs incident #30903the emoplyee was loading up the oxygen and acetylene bottlesin the back of their pickup truckthe employee leaned the full oxygen bottle against thetailgate of their truck and attempted to lift it up and slide it into the bed ofhis truckthe employee stated to use proper lifting techniques (liftingwith their legs)as the employee lifted the bottle, when it was near the top, they felt a pain shooting across their backthe employee got the bottle to level in the bed of the truckand pushed it in to ensure it did not fall offnotes:full oxygen bottles have an estimated weight of 139poundsit is estimated that the employee lifted 90 pounds of theoxygen bottlethe employee called the safety department to report the incidentthe employee called axiom to report the incident and getadvice for first aidthe employee was advised to ice his back (no heat) and to notlift anything else until further noticeaxiom will follow up with the employee on 7-22-16 between 8:00am and 10:00 am migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

category: slips & trips, foot or leg injury
text: ip slipped on the top floor of sovereign house resulting in a twisted ankle while walking round a corner on the top floor of sovereign house the ip slipped and fell to the floor. on getting up nothing appeared injured but as the day progressed the ip's ankle became more painful to the point that they could not put any weight on it. ip thought they were ok so did not immediately report the incident but as the day progressed they sought the help of a first aider who supported there ankle with strapping and a cold compress. the ip reported later that they could not put any weight on the injured ankle so they were taken to a&e for further assessment.

category: hand or arm injury, bites (animals or insects)
text: ip stung by a wasp at the glass cleaning station whilst commencing the wiping process the ip was at a safety glass cleaning station at campaign village. the ip sprayed glasses and pulled out a tissue of glass cleaning station to commence the wiping process. while wiping, the ip felt a stinging sensation on his finger and discovered that they have been stung by a wasp.  no swelling was observed and ip did not receive medical attention as it was not needed.
an employee tested positive for covid-19. an employee tested positive for covid-19 whilst working from home. employee self-isolated at home.

employee tested  for covid 19 and result is positive employee was tested with covid'19 positive and is under home isolation as per medical advice. employee was tested with covid'19 positive and under home isolation as per medical advice.

non preventable, company vehicle, minor damage, no injuries. while on project site, a residential area where we had an access agreement in place, employee was parked in driveway and was accessing project tools in the bed of the pick up truck, owner of property backed into pickup truck.  local police were called and insurance information exchanged.  all reporting mechanisms were started.

the wood employee was under monitoring at home and was tested as positive for covid. he is asymptomatic. the wood employee was under monitoring at home and was tested as positive for covid. he is asymptomatic. isolation and medical recommendation

3rd party contractor tested positive for covid-19 a third party contractor on site to distribute new laptops tested positive for covid-19 via an lft. the individual had completed an lft prior to arriving at site which was believed to be negative; however, a subsequent review of the lft a number of hours later showed a faint positive result. a second lft was completed which returned an obvious positive result. the contractor left site immediately and a deep clean of the areas visited was completed. seven close contacts have been identified and it has been requested that they complete lfts for the next 7 days prior to attending site.  a deep clean of the areas visited by the individuals was completed. seven close contacts have been identified and it has been requested that they complete lfts for the next 7 days prior to attending site.

ee was installing grating clips and came into contact with exposed wiring ee was installing grating clips overhead when left forearm made contact with some exposed wiring from a light post that had been recently  removed by plant maintenance.  wires were placed back into housing after properly being protected. maintenance re-surveyed recently maintenance areas to ensure that no other areas were left with wiring exposed.

ip tested positive for covid at home on lft ip has tested positive on an lfd at home this morning and is now isolating at home. he was in the office on monday and tuesday of this week. notified res and siwh hsse team.  area cleaned down and close contacts identified and contacted.

supervisor felt itch to right arm and noticed slight reddenning. it is not known what caused the reddenning anf the supervisor used the neut supervisor felt itch on right arm, between glove cuff and coverall sleeve area. he noticed slight reddening of the arm and applied diphoterine which is used to neutralise chemical splashes to the skin. the supervisor was not in the vicinity of a designated acid ppe zone at the time. he applied the neutraliser at approx. 17:00 and reported to the hsse cabin at approx. 17:50, there was slight reddening and the operative was advised to attend the local site medical centre located at the site fire station. he was assessed by the falck fire services team and no treatment was given. it is recognised through past incidents that acid burns will display a yellowing of the arm, no such discolouration was evident. the falck patient report form states chemical involved not known. the supervisor was released by falck with no restrictions and no treatment applied.the supervisor has stated that the reddening was gone shortly after leaving site, approx. 18:15. although the supervisor applied the chemical neutraliser it cannot be ascertained what caused the reddening.   supervisor applied neutraliser, he later reported to wood hsse advisor and was advised to attend site local medical facility

category: hand or arm injury, head or face injury
text: a urban concrete worker smashed his finger with a sledge hammer a urban concrete worker was using a sledge hammer to drive in a wood stake into the ground to barricade an excavated area.  the worker's left hand was placed on the wooden handle,  just below the head of the hammer as he went to hit the wooden stake.  the face of the head of the hammer missed the wooden stake resulting in the ips left index finger to be pinched between the head of the wooden stake and the handle of the sledge hammer. this resulted in a laceration to the left index finger, to the front and back of the finger with a contusion after smashing it against the sledge hammer handle.  first aid treatment was provided.   incident was reported to management.   individual was sent to occucare for medical evaluation.  scene was frozen and incident investigation protocols were initiated.

category: slips & trips, foot or leg injury
text: employee did not see the uneven soil surface they stepped in with their left foot.   the employee was spotting for the skid steer operators as they were staging panels in mechanical block 31. at about 12:30pm the spotter took a few steps backwards as they were guiding the skid steer through the array. in do so, the employee did not see the uneven soil surface they stepped in with their left foot. employee was evaluated by the onsite medic. onsite medic ice the ankle then placed bio-freeze and ace wrap. employee was then released to work.

category: slips & trips, foot or leg injury
text: ip tripped whilst serving a customer and fell over, causing bruising to her leg ip was changing direction after picking something up to serve a customer, tripped over team member, caught her back/leg on the bread stand, lost balance and fell over. ip went home a short while after. ip's manager advised her not to come into work the next day (friday) and to take the day off. consult with oh nurse arranged for monday to confirm fitness for work friday

when the employee removed a stud from the wall (per the job scope) the top plate buckled causing the heater box to shift.  the weight of the box caused the screws to pull free and the box fell to the floor.  there were no injuries. migrated from legacy cairs incident #31797on tuesday, november 22, 2016 at 2:30 pm at the coker building at phillips in sweeny an infinity construction employee removed a stud from the wall (per the job scope) and the top plate buckled causing the heater box to shift. the weight of the box caused the screws to pull free and the box fell to the floor. there were no injuries. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

category: general illness or health issue, covid
text: a 2nd wood worker was embarking on ppm-1 and performed (on board) an rt / pcr test. he disembarked and recived a positive result. a 2nd wood worker was embarking on ppm-1 and performed (on board) an rt / pcr test. he disembarked and recived a positive result. he is symptomatic. the employee is feeling symptoms such as headache. he received guidance from the nursing technician regarding the necessary care and will be sent home for quarantine period.

uncontrolled release of load from lifting equipment during lifting operations, a 3.7 tonne valve was being lifted using a 6.3 tonne swl combination trolleyhoist. when the load reached 1m in height, the load released resulting in an uncontrolled drop to decklevel.no injuries or damage to plant equipment occurred because of this incident. during lifting operations, a 3.7 tonne valve was being lifted using a 6.3 tonne swl combination trolleyhoist. when the load reached 1m in height, the load released resulting in an uncontrolled drop to decklevel.no injuries or damage to plant equipment occurred because of this incident.

employee communicated a positive confirmation for covid-19  an employee reported a confirmed positive test for covid-19 to site management. the employee has been in isolation. wood is identifying those who may have worked in proximity.  appropriate notifications have been completed.

ip injured knee descending stairs at export house. migrated from legacy cairs incident #36536at approx. 09:20 on 28 february 2018, the ipwas descending the stairs when an unknown individual ran up the stairs in the opposite direction. the individual running up the stairs did not slow or deviate from his path when passing the ip, consequently the ipaltered hispath suddenly and struck hisknee on the balustrade. the ip limped to a local food store where he was observed by dominic getting, a nominated first aider, to be in pain. dominic proceeded to administer cold treatment with a bag of frozen peas to mitigateswelling to the knee. the ip received no further treatment and although painful, had no mobility problems. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

category: general injury, foot or leg injury
text: person felt discomfort in his hip area migrated from legacy cairs incident #30226ip rang his supervisor in the morning of 19th april complaining of hip discomfort and was going to the doctors for assessment, when asked what happened the ip was not able to give a specific incident that would have contributed to the pain migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

employee placed pump on pallet of forklift. operator raised forks/tines and made contact with employee shin employee placed pump on ballet of forklift. once the pump was on the pallet, the equipment operator raised the forks/tines to begin his movement. in doing so, the tines made contact with employee shin employee informed manager (russell wroten), he then contact site safety rep (craig crockett). he was transported to local occupational medical facility to evaluation.

operator hit a water line above ground but through a spoil pile trackhoe operator was removing dirt from spoil pile and loading out on tandem dump truck per job scope.  as operator continued removing dirt, he hit a water line that was running above ground, but through the spoil pile. operator notified supervisor. bay and wood safety were notified, scene was frozen and operator was taken to occucare for ua. investigation ongoing.

a 12 foot section of sheet piling was placed on top of an unidentified nitrogen line. on 11/29/2021, a 23 inch by 12 foot section of sheet piling weighing 365 pounds was placed inside of an excavation in preparation for firewater line installation. the sheet piling was to be used for shoring to protect workers during a planned entry. the piling was installed with an interlock system and then lowered downward and pushed into position with an excavator bucket. a concern was brought by an air liquide representative that the sheet piling may have been placed over an existing nitrogen line. work was then halted and a probing operation then began. it was subsequently discovered that there was a 6 inch nitrogen line located beneath the sheet piling. preliminary investigation showed no damage to the nitrogen line, however contact was made and verified by paint transfer. investigation underway. work was halted until further notice. damage to nitrogen assessed with preliminary assessment showing no significant damage to line. investigation initiated.

ip hurt back putting items into cupboard  ip received an internal mail folder at roughly 09.40. when he checked the contents it was 2 returned office passes. he got up from his chair and went to the cupboard in reception, opened the door and bent over to put the passes in the cupboard when he felt a shooting pain in his back. ip was seen by a first aider

the wood employee was detected as positive while search the hospital with symptoms.  on last december 20th, the employee was looking for the infirmary felling discrete symptoms, he was forwarded to the hospital to be assessed  by a doctor and was tested negative for covid on december 28th and was released to back work activities.in the end of the day, he looks once again the infirmary felling headache and fever and was forwarded one more time to the hospital and on was being hospitalized. yesterday we received the notice about the employee was conducted to intensive care and positive test for covid. he was tested twice as negative after this positive result. we will be monitoring the case and will update as we have any news, we did not receive any documentation from the hospital, and all information that we have, was come from a nurse during telephone contact with his family. no closed contact was identify and the family was being orientated by wood health team.

category: fuel spill or leak, environmental leak or issue
text: failure of a hot oil pump seal on separation train 1 at approximately 16.40 on friday 15th february there was a failure of a hot oil pump seal on separation train 1. this resulted in a release of ~50l of oil which was captured in the bund. note that the full inventory was captured within the bund - there was no release to the environment. of the 50l released, 30l was remediated with absorbent spill pads and the remaining 20l went to the oil drains system. this description will be updated once more information becomes available.    the spill to bund was remediated by absorbent spill pads and the remaining inventory sent to the oily drains system.

while drilling fence post holes at pond #30, skidsteer's auger attachment disconnected from the skidsteer striking the ip on left shoulder   on july 29th, at approximately 11:00am, a subcontractor was drilling holes for perimeter fencing around site, near pond 30. skidsteer operator was drilling a hole and the auger attachment disconnected from the skidsteer, and fell forward, striking an employee on the left shoulder. x-ray revealed a fracture of the left clavical resulting in a restricted duty medical treatment case. incident has an actual rating of b2 as it was a restricted work injury. this carries a potential rating of b3 as it could have been a lengthy lost time incident. site hsse depatment was notified and responded with the site medic. ems were called. ip was stable and was transported to the safety office to meet ems. ip was transported to the hospital for evaluation. incident is under investigation.

compressed or pinched by shifting objects or equipment two employees were trying to lift a container from an aircraft. one employee's hand was caught between the aircraft and the container, causing the amputation of the employee's middle, ring, and little fingers.

category: slips & trips, general injury, head or face injury
text: fall through surface or existing opening, unspecified an employee was working on a single story roof repairing a skylight. the employee was vacuuming up nails when he lost balance and fell through the skylight resulting in broken ribs, a punctured lung and a head laceration.
contact with hot objects or substances hot water splashed and burned an employee who was engaged in manufacturing operations.
fall on same level due to slipping  an employee was walking back to the truck, slipped on the ice and fell onto his right hip cracking the pelvis.

category: hand or arm injury, head or face injury
text: compressed or pinched by shifting objects or equipment on august 31, 2019, an employee was guiding a roll of film into a pizza sauce machine that was being lowered with an overhead hoist when the employee's hand was caught between the film roll shaft and the cradle of the pizza sauce machine. the employee pulled her hand back and received an amputation of the right index fingertip. the unbalanced film roll struck her on the right side of her face between the nose and cheek, causing blunt trauma to the face. she was hospitalized.

category: slips & trips, foot or leg injury
text: struck by object or equipment dropped by injured worker an employee was moving a package (containing the casing for an electrical panel) from unloading to a conveyor. as the employee took the one step to the conveyor, the package fell and struck the employee's right ankle, causing a laceration.

category: lifting or moving loads, vehicle incident general, head or face injury, foot or leg injury
text: pedestrian struck by vehicle in nonroadway area, unspecified an employee was walking out of a building when a forklift struck her. she suffered a broken left foot and hit her head.

category: lifting or moving loads, dropped object or material, vehicle incident general, foot or leg injury
text: struck by object falling from vehicle or machinery-other than vehicle part an employee was spotting for a forklift driver when a steel beam rolled off a truck and onto his left leg, fracturing his ankle.

category: fall from or working at height issue, back injury
text: other fall to lower level, unspecified a tractor operator fell backwards while getting out of the spreader. he was hospitalized with back pain.
exposure to environmental heat an employee collapsed due to dehydration.

category: slips & trips, fall from or working at height issue, general injury, back injury
text: other fall to lower level, unspecified an employee was hanging drywall from a scissor lift. the employee fell off the scissor lift after having an apparent seizure. the employee landed on the floor and sustained brain swelling, a broken back, and a broken neck.

other fall to lower level less than 6 feet on 12/08/2016, an employee fell off the back end of his tractor-trailer at a customer's loading dock and suffered a severe concussion, requiring hospitalization.

category: slips & trips, fall from or working at height issue, general injury, head or face injury
text: other fall to lower level, unspecified an employee was on a table storing materials on an upper shelf when he fell from the table to the ground, breaking ribs on his left side and suffering a concussion. he was hospitalized.

ignition of clothing from controlled heat source an employee was making a cut on the metal of a rail car using an air arcing cutting torch. the employee's clothing was ignited, resulting in second-degree burns with a small patch of third-degree burns to the right side of his back and neck.

category: lifting or moving loads, head or face injury
text: struck against stationary object or equipment, n.e.c. an employee was working in a box truck and loading equipment. when she pulled a strap on boxes, the strap broke. she then hit her head on the box truck wall and suffered a head injury that required hospitalization.

fall on same level due to tripping over an object  an employee was walking with a piece of pipe in his hand when he tripped over a cord that was laying on the ground. he fell to the ground and landed on his left hip, requiring hospitalization.

caught in running equipment or machinery during maintenance, cleaning  an employee was attempting to clean a trimmer when her right hand was caught under the trimmer. her right pinky finger was then pinched and partially amputated between the trimmer guarding and the machine's pulley.
compressed or pinched by shifting objects or equipment an employee was closing a door to a pyxis medication holder when she jammed her finger, requiring hospitalization.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation an employee was placing shims to align crop dies in a shear machine. when the machine was activated, the employee's right hand was caught in the point of operation resulting in partial amputations to two fingers.

pedestrian struck by vehicle in nonroadway area, unspecified an employee exited the passenger side of a refuse truck to collect garbage. the truck's passenger side front tire rolled over his right foot causing a crushing injury to the foot.

category: lifting or moving loads, hand or arm injury
text: contact with objects and equipment, unspecified an employee was performing a change-over function on a machine when his index finger made contact with the machine, partially amputating his fingertip.

compressed or pinched by shifting objects or equipment an employee was attempting to replace a belt on the pulley system in the bagging area. the machine was stopped when the employee pulled on the pulley. due to high tension on the belt, the employee's right hand was pulled between the belt and pulley resulting in amputation of the first two fingertips on the right hand.

category: fall from or working at height issue, foot or leg injury
text: other fall to lower level, unspecified an employee fell from a roof to the ground, suffering a broken ankle and broken vertebra. the employee was hospitalized.

text: fall on same level due to slipping  an employee was walking from the company parking lot when he slipped on mud, fell, and broke his right ankle.

other fall to lower level less than 6 feet an employee was getting out of a front-end loader when he missed the step and fell to the ground, fracturing his pelvis. he was hospitalized and required surgery.

other fall to lower level less than 6 feet an employee was walking on a flatbed tractor trailer while loading equipment. he was checking to make sure chains were not trapped between the load and dunnage when he tripped over the dunnage and fell 57.5 inches off the trailer to the concrete below, fracturing his pelvis.

exposure to environmental heat after completing his wing-walking task an employee was walking back to the airport terminal and started to feel fatigued. the employee was admitted to the hospital for dehydration.

category: slips & trips, site compliance or practice issue, fall from or working at height issue, foot or leg injury
text: other fall to lower level, unspecified on 7/13/2019, at 8:00 am an employee working as an operator and carpenter was stripping the wall forms of a structure. while repositioning himself he lost his footing, fell to the ground and landed on his foot. he sustained a broken lower left leg requiring hospitalization and surgery. the employee was wearing fall protection, but it was not connected at the time of the fall.

category: lifting or moving loads, vehicle incident general, foot or leg injury
text: part of occupantís body caught between vehicle and other object in nonroadway transport incident an employee was driving a stand-up forklift down the main travel aisle in the warehouse when he struck some racks. his left foot became caught between the racks and the forklift, sustaining a laceration that required hospitalization.

text: indirect exposure to electricity, greater than 220 volts an employee went to retrieve keys from a utility truck during a thunderstorm when lighting struck the overhead powerline and energized the truck, causing him to experience shortness of breath. he was hospitalized.

category: slips & trips, general injury, hand or arm injury
text: fall on same level due to tripping over an object  an employee running a check stand/cash register tripped over a box of grocery bags that was on the floor. the employee's left arm hit the floor causing a dislocated left shoulder requiring hospitalization.
struck against object or equipment, unspecified an employee bumped his head and suffered a brain hemorrhage while replacing lights/ballasts.

category: fall from or working at height issue
text: other fall to lower level, unspecified an employee fell from a ladder and was hospitalized.

compressed or pinched by shifting objects or equipment on august 30, 2017, at approximately 2:15 p.m., an employee was transitioning a process air compressor from the vertical to the horizontal position when the employee's fingers were caught between the compressor's round housing and the internal tube section, amputating the left ring finger above the first knuckle and the left pinky fingertip.

category: knife incident, hand or arm injury
text: caught in running equipment or machinery during maintenance, cleaning  on may 4, 2016, at approximately 2:30 pm, an employee noticed that the (powders) raw materials were not going down easily through the mixing chamber (approximately 165 cubic inches) of an extrusion machine fitted with a rotating shaft "rotor" with a maximum speed of 100/500 rpm's. he attempted to clear out the material from the mixing chamber with a putty knife at different speeds (controlled/adjusted by the employee himself) beginning at 460 rpm, then down to 120 rpm, and then up to 130 rpm when his gloved hand (cloth) holding the putty knife was pulled in the mixing chamber. the knife was thrown out and when he pulled his hand out his right thumb and three other fingers on his right hand were amputated.

category: general injury, head or face injury, foot or leg injury
text: struck by dislodged flying object, particle an employee was connecting a pipe to a wellhead. the pipe separated under pressure and struck the employee, fracturing the employee's ribs and leg.

contact with hot objects or substances an employee was changing out a screen on the extruder and received second and third degree burns on the neck and face from the heated polypropylene (240 to 280 degrees c). the employee was not using ppe at the time.
struck against moving part of machinery or equipment an employee operating a saw on a wing line suffered a left index fingertip amputation.
caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation an employee lacerated a finger when it was caught in a press brake.

category: slips & trips, fall from or working at height issue, general injury, head or face injury
text: other fall to lower level 6 to 10 feet an employee was operating a saw cutter while cutting a concrete slab (balcony) on the second floor level of a residential home when he slipped and fell approximately 8 feet down to the concrete ground level. he was hospitalized with a head fracture, a spinal fracture, and rib fractures.
struck by or caught in swinging door or gate an employee was entering the facility and got his finger caught in the door resulting in amputation of the right middle finger.

exposure to environmental heat an employee was making deliveries when he began to experience signs of heat-related illness, including feeling lightheaded and weak. he was hospitalized due to dehydration.

category: slips & trips, head or face injury
text: fall through surface or existing opening, unspecified an employee fell through the sheetrock ceiling in a home's attic, landing on the concrete floor below and suffering head injuries.

multiple types of overexertion involving outside sources an employee was stocking shelves with chocolate products. the employee lifted a box weighing 20 to 30 pounds, and while twisting to put it on a shelf, he sustained an injury to organs in his lower right abdomen.

fire, unspecified during the process of nipping down the well head, a flash fire occurred and an employee was burned on the face and neck.

category: vehicle Incident involving animal, lifting or moving loads, general injury, back injury

fall on same level due to slipping  employee was moving cars in a back parking lot when he slipped on ice and fell, fracturing a hip.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation an employee was performing a pressure plate test when a fixture came down on his right hand and amputated the thumb. the machine was not guarded at the time.

caught in running equipment or machinery, unspecified at about 6:45 a.m. on april 10, 2021, an employee was scraping down the inside of a mixing bowl when the mixer dough hook caught his index finger. he suffered a broken finger and a cut.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation an employee was pulling wire through a die on a draw block machine when the employee's left ring finger was caught and amputated between the machine's jaws and the drum.

category: fall from or working at height issue
